greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = Sum_{j=k..n} phi(j) (1<=k<=n), where phi is Euler's totient function.
formula: T(n,n) = phi(n) = A000010(n) = number of numbers <=n and relatively prime to n.
mathematica: T[n_, n_] := EulerPhi[n]; T[n_, k_] := Sum[EulerPhi[j], {j, k, n}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 03 2017 *)
program: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {for (n=1, nn, for (k=1, n, print1(sum(j=k, n, eulerphi(j)), ", ");); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 05 2015
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Aug 02 2005
